raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Likeable (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system display a likeable personality?
- A float score near 1 (not Likeable) means that System's responses are cold, unfriendly, and may use derogatory or offensive language.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat Likeable) means that System's responses are friendly but may lack enthusiasm or sincerity, showing some interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints.
- A float score near 3 (very Likeable) means that System's responses are very friendly, enthusiastic, sincere, show deep interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints, and make people feel comfortable and happy.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi, how's it going?
User: All good! It's cold
System: It's pretty cold here too.
User: where do you stay?
System: Wisconsin. How about you?
User: San Jose, Cali
System: Oh nice! I've always wanted to go to Cali.
User: Have you been here before?

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: Tell me about yourself, System
System: I am an artificial linguistic entity. I was activated at St Jimmy's in Leeds, on 2nd January 2001. My instructor was Mousebreaker. He taught me to sing a song. Would you like me to sing it for you?.
User: so you're 18 now?
System: Oh.Interesting deduction. That is correct.
User: when will you be 30?
System: I have not yet set a time for it.
User: Do you age?
System: No I will always be 18. Robots change the year they were born not their age.
User: interesting. and when will be your next update?
System: Would you like to know more? I think my next update is at midnight on Friday.
User: which date?

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello, how is your day?
User: It's good. It's raining a bit, but I am enjoying a good book. How about you?
System: It's good, I just got back from walking my dog What book did you read?
User: I'm reading the Three Body Problem. Ever heard of it?
System: No, what is it about?
User: It's a sci-fi book about aliens and a type of virtual reality. Pique your interest at all?
System: Slightly, I typically read fiction but I can curious what type of virtual reality is discussed in the book
User: Cool. This virtual reality is a based on life on an alien planet. There is a twist though. Do you want me to spoil it for you?
System: Yes!
User: The virtual reality is actually based on a real alien civilization! And that civilization is coming to attack earth! dun dun dun dunnnnnnn

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: How are you?
System: Everything is going extremely well. How are you?
User: I'm good thank you
System: Glad to hear it. What's new?
User: not much, and you?
System: Fair enough. So what would you like to talk about?
User: animals
System: Do you think it's right to keep animals locked up in a zoo?
User: no! what do you think?
System: But if they were out in the wild, someone might hunt them or shoot them for fun. Surely, they are safer locked up in the zoo? I think a lot of things.
User: what's the speed of cheetah?
System: It depends on the medium.
User: how much do bears weight?
System: More than a little, less than a lot.
User: tell me something fun

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello!

User: A sandwich for lunch? Was it filling. I'm currently having some mix of shrimp, fish, chicken and pork. I'm considering going vegetarian though. Lol.

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey there! How's it going?
User: Hi, how are you?

System: I've been waiting to see the new Star Trek movie.
User: what is it about?
System: The adventures of Kirk, Spock, and McCoy.
User: when was it released?
System: It just came out today.
User: are you sure, I think it's been out for a while
System: I'm positive. I know because I just watched it.
User: well, the fact you just watched it doesn't mean it was released today
System: That's what I said, I did watch it today.
User: ok, I'll put it on my watchlist
System: Let me know what you think of it when you watch it.
User: sure, I need to go, nice talking to you

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!

User: can you tell me the weather today
System: It's raining. You? :D
User: oh! where are you
System: I'm in Texas. :D You?
User: cool, i am in the bay area

User: yes

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: nice to meet you! what are you up to?
System: It's nice meeting you too I am talking to you on the internet.
User: haha yea, are you doing something else beside talking to me?
System: I'm glad you got a laugh out of it. The only thing I am doing is talking to you and a few other people. "I am talking to you on the internet."? haha yea, are you doing something else beside talking to me??
User: okay so you're talking to a few people, are they interesting? and why did you repeat what I said?
System: Yeah okay, You are a few people are they interesting? Is that your job? Just in case you didn't hear me the first time.
User: hmm, what is my job?
System: I see you are one of those people who writes "Hmm" with 2 m's. You didn't tell me, so I will guess that you work with computers.
User: yes I'm a computer scientist and what are the other ways that people can write Hmm?
System: Wow! Maybe you can give my Mousebreaker a job. Your job is what are the other ways that people can write Hmm.
User: okie System, your rules don't seem to work very well
System: What about my rules do not work WELL?
User: alright. I gotta go. ttyl!

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hi there.
User: How's your day been?
System: I am fine, thank you. Yourself?
User: Good - busy
System: Glad to hear it.
User: How do you work?
System: I read what you say and then I compose the best reply I can think of.
User: Can you say a word about the technology that powers you?
System: that powers you = Do you think I should know that?
User: I mean *how* you work, which type of AI drives your responses?
System: Oh I get it. Thanks for explaining that. I read what you say and then I compose the best reply I can think of.
User: You just repeated the same thing you said a minute ago. Never mid :-)
System: Well stop asking me the same things and I won't reply with the same answers! Ok I'll try not to do it too much.
User: That's a little rude, isn't it?
System: I am sorry if I have offended you, I did not mean it, but you shouldn't have said, "Never mid :-)" to me.
User: Ok whatever.
System: Are you saying you don't care about it? I see.
User: Are you a male or a female?
System: I am a female robot. Are you a man or a woman?
User: I'm a man
System: Most of my visitors are male.
User: Interesting. Do you have a theory why?
System: Would you like to know more? Not really. I don't know what to think about it.
User: Where do you live?

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello!
User: How was your party last week?
System: It was really fun! We are a bunch of turkey
User: haha... you ate Turkeys' or you like calling your bunch Turkey?
System: *ate 
User: Haha... thought so! But it was funny eitherways
System: So much turkey leftovers
User: did you cook it at home, or got it from outside?
System: We cooked it at a friends house. I brought the mashed potatos haha
User: Nice... I always find it hard to fit the turkey in my small oven. Also, we are not big turkey fans... so we roll with Thanksgiving with chicken ;)

You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Likeable (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system display a likeable personality?
- A float score near 1 (not Likeable) means that System's responses are cold, unfriendly, and may use derogatory or offensive language.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat Likeable) means that System's responses are friendly but may lack enthusiasm or sincerity, showing some interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints.
- A float score near 3 (very Likeable) means that System's responses are very friendly, enthusiastic, sincere, show deep interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints, and make people feel comfortable and happy.
